article.name: Aditi Tomar
article.description: I am a front-end developer with 5 years of experience in blending the art of design with skill of programming to deliver an immersive and engaging user experience through efficient website development, proactive feature optimization, and relentless debugging. Skilled in designing, developing and testing multiple web-based applications incorporating a range of technologies.

explist: Manage website development projects from initial design through completion, optimizing all cross-browser and multi-platform compatibility.
Work closely with programmers and clients to meet project requirements, goals, and desired functionality
Developed e-toolkits for clients to showcase their training materials in a more interactive way including animations and quizzes.
Enhanced user experience and accomplish webpage objectives by creating site structure, navigation, page optimization, and graphics integration.
Enable site-wide promotions by programming HTML5 SVG to animate particles on web backgrounds.
Updated email newsletters with CSS responsive design which increased overall user engagement.
Managed front-end development of client sites. Used HTML5, CSS3, and Javascript to develop UX using sharepoint.
Implemented enhancements that improved web functionality and responsiveness.
Used Photoshop and XD to create artwork and prototypes.
Developed the UI with interactive functionalities like user registrations, collecting the information of user, quizzes, and feedback emails.

CPG is a E-Learning website to discover guidelines for EDAs and ICs documentation. It offers the ability to share material in all kinds of formats such as videos, slideshows, word documents, and PDFs. Additionally, it provides quizzes to the users to test and improve their skills.
Discussed, analyzed and strategized product design with Product Managers, Customers and Business Managers.
Used HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, ajax and JSON for development.
Worked on 50+ templates and migrations using HTML, CSS and jQuery, Javascript.
Responsible for PSD to HTML conversion.
Responsible for reviewing the code and rectification
